verses.translation: About what are they asking one another?
About the momentous news[1],
that which they differ about[2].
No indeed; they will come to know.
Again no; they will come to know.
Have We not made the earth a resting place?
And the mountains as stakes[3],
and created you in pairs,
and made your sleep for rest,
and made the night a covering[4],
and made the day for seeking a livelihood,
and built above you seven mighty heavens,
and made therein a blazing lamp,
and sent down from the rainclouds abundant water,
so that We may produce thereby grains and vegetation,
and gardens with dense foliage?
Indeed, the Day of Judgment is a time appointed,

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجٗا
verses.translation: the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will come forth in crowds,
and the sky will be opened up and will become gateways,
and the mountains will vanish, becoming like a mirage.
Indeed, Hell is lying in wait,
a resort for the transgressors,
wherein they will abide for endless ages.

verses.arabic_text: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرۡدٗا وَلَا شَرَابًا
verses.translation: They will neither taste therein any coolness nor any drink,
except for scalding water and discharge of wounds,
a fitting recompense[5].
Indeed, they did not expect a reckoning,
and utterly rejected Our verses.
But We have enumerated everything in a record[6].
So taste [the punishment], for We will not increase you except in torment[7].”
Indeed, the righteous will have salvation[8],
gardens and vineyards,
and full-bosomed maidens of equal age,
and a full cup [of wine][9].

verses.arabic_text: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا كِذَّٰبٗا
verses.translation: They will not hear therein vain talk or lies –
a reward and a generous gift from your Lord[10],

verses.arabic_text: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابٗا
verses.translation: [from] the Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the Most Compassionate; none will dare to speak to Him[11].

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفّٗاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابٗا
verses.translation: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows; none will dare to speak, except those to whom the Most Compassionate granted permission, and they will only speak the truth.

verses.arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
verses.translation: That Day is sure to come. So whoever wills may seek a path leading to his Lord[12].

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَنذَرۡنَٰكُمۡ عَذَابٗا قَرِيبٗا يَوۡمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَٰبَۢا
verses.translation: Indeed, We have warned you of an imminent punishment on the Day when everyone will see what his hands have sent forth[13], and the disbeliever will say, “Oh, I wish that I were dust!”
